p: EEEV do not persist in the environment, and are susceptible to many common disinfectants including 1 % sodium hypochlorite, 70 % ethanol, 2 % glutaraldehyde and formaldehyde. EEEV can be inactivated by exposure to 50 % ethanol at concentration for 60 min, also by moist or dry heat, or by drying, or by UV rays (Aguilar et al. 2005).
